view.name: Health and Care Information Models (HCIM) 2017 Index

concept.name: Alert
concept.desc: Root concept of the Alert information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Alert information model.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: In 6.12 is het niet toegestaan om condities te ontkennen, als dit tóch gebeurt worden deze condities niet gemapt.

concept.name: Basic Components HCIMRoot
concept.desc: Rootconcept of the information model in question

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: 6.12 kent geen apart concept voor Alert, maar legt alleen een diagnose vast én maakt deze onderdeel van een ICA-transactie. Diagnose mapt op zib Probleem, die ook onderdeel is van Alert. De gegevens uit basiscomponenten worden daarom gevuld bij de zib Probleem en niet bij alert.

concept.name: IdentificationNumber
concept.desc: Globally unique number that identifies the instantiation of the information model. The number is composed of an identification of the issuer organization and a unique number assigned by this organization

concept.name: InformationSource
concept.desc:
The person who provided the information and ensures the correctness of it.
This is not always a healthprofessional, but it may also be the patient or another person, such as a parent, caretaker or guardian.
The source of information does not have to be the author of the information, who in that case is only instrumental in capturing the information.

concept.name: PatientAsInformationSource
concept.desc: The patient as source of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc: The health professional as source of the information

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc:
Root concept of the HealthProfessional information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the HealthProfessional information model.
When referring to this information model the role the health professional fulfils in the healthcare process can be addressed additionally. For health professionals, this could be for example main practitioner or referrer.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsInformationSource
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as source of the information

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: Author
concept.desc: The person who has recorded the information. Depending on the information system in which the data is recorded, this may be the patient, healthcare provider or other person.

concept.name: PatientAsAuthor
concept.desc: The patient as author of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: HealthProfessionalAsAuthor
concept.desc: The health professional as author of the information

concept.name: HealthProfessional
concept.desc:
Root concept of the HealthProfessional information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the HealthProfessional information model.
When referring to this information model the role the health professional fulfils in the healthcare process can be addressed additionally. For health professionals, this could be for example main practitioner or referrer.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsAuthor
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as author of the information

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: Subject
concept.desc: The person to whom the information relates. Often this will be the patient, but especially in the case of small children as patients it may be information about the parent or caregiver. Especially in the nurse transfers, for example, Competence and involvement of caregivers carries a role.

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: The patient as subject of the information

concept.name: Patient
concept.desc: Root concept of the Patient information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Patient information model.

concept.name: RelatedPersonAsSubject
concept.desc: The related person (parent, caregiver, ...) as subject of the information

concept.name: Contact
concept.desc: Root concept of the Contact information model. This root concept contains all data elements of the Contact information model.

concept.name: DateTime
concept.desc:
Date and if relevant the time the event to which the information relates took place .
This is the medically relevant date and time.

concept.name: Condition
concept.desc:
The patient’s health problem or condition that is the subject of the alert. This could involve a patient’s problem, condition or diagnosis that is seen as a contraindication in prescribing medication or which has to be taken into account when shaping diagnostic and therapeutic policy. This can be in the patient’s own interest, or it can involve a problem or disorder that can make the patient a risk to their surroundings, such as an infection hazard. These are references to conditions included on the patient’s problem list.
If there is a contraindication, the code system G-Standard Contraindications (Table 40) from the ProblemNameCodeList of the Problem information model should be used.

community.data: In 6.12 is het niet toegestaan om condities te ontkennen, als dit tóch gebeurt worden deze condities niet gemapt.

condition.desc: One concept must be selected in this selection box [AlertNaam | Conditie]

concept.name: Problem
concept.desc:
Root concept of the Problem information model.
A problem describes a situation with regard to an individual’s health and/or welfare. This situation can be described by the patient himselve (in the form of a complaint) or by their healthprofessional (in the form of a diagnosis, for example).

concept.name: InformationSource
concept.desc:
The person who provided the information and ensures the correctness of it.
This is not always a healthprofessional, but it may also be the patient or another person, such as a parent, caretaker or guardian.
The source of information does not have to be the author of the information, who in that case is only instrumental in capturing the information.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: ZIB BasisElementen heeft nu exact 1 informant. FHIR kent 0..1 informant. De 6.12 condition kan er echter 0..* bevatten. Aangemeld bij het bestaande [https://bits.nictiz.nl/browse/ZIB-737 ZIB issue 737]

concept.desc: Anatomical location which is the focus of the procedure.

concept.desc: Laterality adds information about body side to the anatomic location, e.g. left

concept.desc: The type of problem; see the concept description.

community.data: Condition/code heeft vaste waarde 'DX', hetgeen mapt op Diagnose

concept.name: ProblemName
concept.desc: The problem name defines the problem. Depending on the setting, different code systems can be used. The ProblemNameCodelist provides an overview of the possible code systems.

valueSet.name: ProbleemNaamCodelijst
valueSet.desc:
• SNOMED CT - Alle waarden binnen de SNOMED CT referentieset Diagnosethesaurus DHD (was: 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.3.120.5.1)
  • ICD-10 - Alle waarden
  • SNOMED CT - Alle waarden binnen de SNOMED CT referentieset Nationale Kernset Patiëntproblemen V&VN (was: 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.3.11.26.4)
  • NANDA-I - Alle waarden
  • Omaha Systems - Alle waarden
  • ICF - Alle waarden
  • ICPC-1 NL - Alle waarden
  • G-Standaard Contra Indicaties (Tabel 40) - Alle waarden
  • DSM-IV - Alle waarden
  • DSM-V - Alle waarden

concept.name: ProblemStartDate
concept.desc: Onset of the disorder to which the problem applies. Especially in symptoms in which it takes longer for the final diagnosis, it is important to know not only the date of the diagnosis, but also how long the patient has had the disorder. A ‘vague’ date, such as only the year or the month and the year, is permitted.

concept.name: ProblemEndDate
concept.desc: Date on which the disorder to which the problem applies, is considered not to be present anymore.This datum needs not to be the same as the date of the change in problem status. A ‘vague’ date, such as only the year or the month and the year, is permitted.

concept.name: ProblemStatus
concept.desc:
The problem status describes the condition of the problem:
Active problems are problems of which the patient experiences symptoms or for which evidence exists.
Problems with the status 'Inactive' refer to problems that don't affect the patient anymore or that of which there is no evidence of existence anymore.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: * active -> actueel * completed, obsolete, nullified -> niet actueel

valueSet.name: ProbleemStatusCodelijst
valueSet.copyright: This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyright of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Implementers of these artefacts must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/getsnomed-ct or info@snomed.org.

concept.name: VerificationStatus
concept.desc: Clinical status of the problem or the diagnosis.

valueSet.name: VerificatieStatusCodelijst
valueSet.copyright: This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyright of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Implementers of these artefacts must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/getsnomed-ct or info@snomed.org.

concept.name: Comment
concept.desc: Comment by the one who determined or updated the Problem.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: 6.12 heeft bij de comment ook verplicht een auteur, waarin een tijdstip en zorgverlener/id kan worden vastgelegd.

terminologyAssociation.codeSystemName: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes

concept.name: AlertName
concept.desc:
A warning, other than a condition or problem. For example, a patient can be given an ‘Aggressive patient' alert.
The warning can be entered in code (there are codes for frequently used alerts), but seeing the dynamic nature of the warnings cf. SARS and Ebola, these alerts will often be entered as free text.

condition.desc: One concept must be selected in this selection box [AlertNaam | Conditie]

valueSet.name: AlertNaamCodelijst
valueSet.copyright: This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyright of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Implementers of these artefacts must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact http://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/getsnomed-ct or info@snomed.org.

concept.name: StartDateTime
concept.desc:
The date and time at which the described condition was entered as a warning.
This can be an exact date and time, or a rough indication of the date (such as only the year, or the month and the year).

concept.name: AlertType
concept.desc: Indicates the type of alert, meaning a rough description of the cause or origin of the warning.

community.name: ICA612_2_MedMij112Alert
community.data: mappen als 'conditie'. 6.12 kent het type 'alert' niet.
